'''''Peredhil''''' (IPA: ['pɛrɛðilʲ])(sing. '''''Peredhel''''' (IPA: ['pɛrɛðɛlʲ])) was a name for the "[[Half-elven]]" in [[Sindarin]].<ref>{{S|Index}}: "''Half-elven'' Translation of Sindarin ''Peredhel'', plural ''Peredhil''"</ref><ref name="App">{{S|Appendix}}: "''edhel'' 'elf' (Sindarin) in [...] ''Peredhil'' 'Half-elven'"</ref><ref>{{App|A1i}}, p. 1034 ([[The Lord of the Rings (50th Anniversary Edition)|50th Anniv. Ed.]])</ref> [[Elrond|Elrond Half-elven]] and [[Elros|Elros Tar-Minyatur]] were named Peredhil.

==Etymology==
The word consists of the elements ''[[per-]]'', "half"<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 380, entry ''PER-''</ref> and ''[[edhel]]'' "[[Elves|elf]]".<ref name="App" />
